title.value: Better Training of GFlowNets with Local Credit and Incomplete Trajectories
title.justification: This is the title of the research paper mentioned by the user.
title.quote: Better Training of GFlowNets with Local Credit and Incomplete Trajectories

extractions.description: This paper introduces Forward-Looking Generative Flow Networks (FL-GFN). The novel approach leverages partial reward signals available at intermediate states using a reparameterization of the GFlowNet state flow function. This technique allows for improved credit assignment and the ability to learn from incomplete trajectories, promising faster convergence and better performance. The paper conducts extensive experiments in set generation, bit sequence generation, and molecule discovery to demonstrate the efficacy of FL-GFN.

type.justification: Extensive experiments are conducted to validate the proposed FL-GFN method, including set generation, bit sequence generation, and molecule discovery.
type.quote: We conduct extensive experiments to demonstrate the effectiveness of FL-GFN, which can scale to complex and challenging tasks, such as molecular graph generation.

name.justification: The paper primarily discusses a novel technique within the domain of generative models and reinforcement learning, which are sub-fields of machine learning.
name.quote: Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) are variants of reinforcement learning (RL) methods (Sutton & Barto, 2018) trained to generate an object x.

name.justification: The paper discusses GFlowNets, which are related to reinforcement learning methods and explore learning a policy to generate sequences of states.
name.quote: Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) are variants of reinforcement learning (RL) methods (Sutton & Barto, 2018) trained to generate an object x.

name.justification: GFlowNets are a type of generative model aimed at learning to represent and sample from a distribution.
name.quote: They are also related to generative models (Kingma & Welling, 2013; Goodfellow et al., 2014; 2016; Ho et al., 2020) as they learn to represent and sample from a distribution.

name.justification: FL-GFN is the proposed novel approach in the paper.
name.quote: We propose a novel GFlowNets formulation, FL-GFN, that can exploit the existence of a per-state or per-transition energy function.

is_contributed.justification: The model FL-GFN is a contribution of this paper as it is proposed by the authors as a novel formulation for more efficient credit assignment and learning from incomplete trajectories.
is_contributed.quote: We propose Forward-Looking GFlowNets (FL-GFN), a novel formulation that exploits the computability of a per-state or per-transition energy function.

is_executed.justification: The experiments conducted in the paper to validate FL-GFN likely involve the execution of the model.
is_executed.quote: The code is publicly available at https://github.com/ling-pan/FL-GFN.

is_compared.justification: FL-GFN is compared to several other GFlowNet objectives such as Detailed Balance (DB), Trajectory Balance (TB), and Subtrajectory Balance (SubTB) in various tasks.
is_compared.quote: The first column in Figure 2 demonstrates the quality of generated sets in the set generation task with different problem sizes...The second column in Figure 2 illustrates the number of modes...FL-GFN discovers many more high-reward modes faster.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific referenced paper title for FL-GFN was provided in the text.

name.justification: The dataset is used to measure the performance of FL-GFN and other methods in generating molecules with desirable properties.
name.quote: and scalable to the more complex and challenging molecule discovery task.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific referenced paper title was provided for the molecule discovery dataset.

name.justification: The use of neural networks and the context strongly suggests the use of PyTorch for implementing and running deep learning models, although it is not explicitly mentioned.
name.quote: The GFlowNet model is a Transformer (Vaswani et al., 2017) consisting of 3 hidden layers with 64 hidden units per layer and has 8 attention heads.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific referenced paper title for PyTorch was provided in the text.
